The Toledo Museum of Art is currently accepting applications for the 2020-2021 Teen Leader Program. The application deadline is July 27th, 2020. In this program, students will provide creative insights and guidance for the expansion of teen experiences at TMA, while practicing communication, collaboration, and creative thinking skills. Participants will learn about the Museum and the collection, meet artists and peers; design upcoming (Y)our Night events; and develop new opportunities for Toledo teens to engage with TMA and art!

The application link is below for high school age students; with your help we can achieve our goal of making arts experiences readily accessible to Toledo youth. For questions or more information please contact Annie Noel, youth programs coordinator at anoel@toledomuseum.org

Throughout this summer we will be featuring student artwork in support of BLM.

"This was a piece I dedicated to George Floyd because his name was catching headlines across the globe as we watched what happened to him. The world watched him suffer on the pavement as a white police officer (Derek Chauvin) pressed his knee to George‘s neck for nearly nine minutes during his arrest even after he died on the street. George was born to this world thinking he was just a ordinary person, but little did he know that he simply changed the world forever and America will forever be changed because of him. George’s life has reshaped what my future looks like in this country and this creation of mine was just a simple thank you from me to him. Black Lives Matter Now and Forever."

-Nickolas Stewart
TSA Class of ‘19

post_text:
Shout out to Zoë Kuehn

When you first held a pencil, you stared at the alphabet magnets on the fridge and wrote the letters perfectly on your first try. From drawing, coloring and painting, you moved on to hilarious impressions of Sarah Palin and Lisa Simpson. Then violin lessons. And in the blink of an eye, you were a 6th grade visual arts major at TSA. Then came Little Prince, and Radium Girls where your beautiful presence left its mark on our hearts. Enter: the world of Musical Theater, (and oh, that voice!), followed by your journey into filmmaking, editing and writing. And rockin’ out in Pop Combo this year has been the icing on the cake. Looking forward to your your next chapter as you say farewell to TSA and hello to Columbia College and Chicago! “Oh the places you’ll go...”

We are so proud of you.

Love,

Mom, Poppy and Stefan

April 27 at 12:15 PM ·

Today’s #ToledoBalletSeniorSpotlight is Kendra!

Kendra is a senior at Toledo School for the Arts who has studied at Toledo Ballet for 6 years. Her favorite performances that she’s danced in were “Lights.Camera.Limitless” and New Beginnings. Aside from dance, Kendra teaches workout classes, coaches tennis, and is a part of the Toledo School for the Arts dance team.

After graduation, Kendra will be attending the Dayton Medical Massage School and also attend a training program at Dayton Ballet.

When asked about a favorite memory or valuable lesson that she’s learned at Toledo Ballet, Kendra says, “Toledo Ballet has been able to teach me what it means to be the dancer and person I want to be. I got the chance to assist Mrs. Ann’s Adaptive Dance classes and because of that, I have gained my strength, love, and respect for dance.”

Congratulations, Kendra! Best of luck in all of your future endeavors!

shared_text:
FOWLANDFODDER.COM
Celebrate Life's Sweetness

Fowl and Fodder
March 13 at 11:29 AM ·

If you knew Jason Thomas then you know that he was a nurturer. He fed people. He especially liked to feed people pie on Pi Day, ‪March 14‬, because that represented an intersection of his love of science and preparing food for others. His peanut butter pie is almost famous if you ask his family, friends, and students. And so on this Pi Day we hope you will head to one of the Fowl and Fodder - Downtown Toledo restaurants – either the downtown location on Adams Street or the Sylvania location on Central Avenue – and partake in a Jason Thomas peanut butter pie in his memory. Using Jason’s recipe, Fowl & Fodder will be selling individual peanut butter pies for $3.14 each during their Saturday business hours of ‪8:00-4:00‬.

The world still needs Jason Thomas, so we’re doing our best to carry forward the love and lessons he imparted. Please take a loved one with you to Fowl & Fodder and savor life’s sweetness in memory of Jason.

post_text: Toledo School for the Arts mourns the passing of an authentic Toledo treasure, Richard (“Dick”) Anderson. Dick and his wife Fran have been friends and supporters of the school since our early days. Dick’s interest in the school and the children whom we serve was genuine and steadfast. A truly kind soul who gave generously of his time, talent, and treasure to numerous organizations in our area, Dick was the embodiment of the expression “salt of the earth.” Our deepest condolences to Fran and the entire Anderson family.

post_text: 6th, 7th, and 8th graders in Ms. Horvath's Art Explorations classes learned about the block-printed fabric traditions of the Indian Subcontinent. Artists working in this tradition frequently use local plant-life as their subject matter. Inspired by this technique, Ms. Horvath's students walked around the TSA neighborhood and used their iPads to photograph interesting plants and leaves they came across. Then, they created a two-color design based on their favorite photo. This design was made into two different carved rubber printing blocks - one for each color. They selected a solid color fabric, gridded it off, then began printing - the lighter color was printed first, then the darker color was added on top. When the ink was dry, they pinned and hand-stitched it to a backing fabric. After turning right side out, the pillow was stuffed and stitched shut. Look at the beautiful pillows they created!

post_text: The December Sunshine Staff Spotlight is Ms. Prior! Ms. Prior is the 6th grade social studies teacher at Toledo School for the Arts. She has been at TSA for 8 years & teaching for 14! She is one of a kind & goes above & beyond her normal teaching duties. Ms. Prior said one of her favorite memories at TSA happened on her first day of school back in 2012. She said she immediately knew she found her forever home on the Island of Misfit Toys when a student showed up wearing a glittery tutu & a tiara, not because they were excited about dance or ballet, but because they were finally free to be who they really were & dress however they wanted! She said she loves the sense of family here & how everyone will always have your back & be your cheerleader. We are SO thankful we have Ms. Prior as our own unicorn-loving supporter who truly makes a difference in the lives of each student she meets!

Tomorrow is #GivingTuesday!
What is #GivingTuesday?

#GivingTuesday is a global day of giving fueled by the power of social media and collaboration.
Celebrated on the Tuesday following Thanksgiving (in the U.S.) and the widely recognized shopping events Black Friday and Cyber Monday, #GivingTuesday kicks off the charitable season, when many focus on their holiday and end-of-year giving.
One of the best ways to get involved is in your own community.

How can I give to TSA on #GivingTuesday?

Please visit our #GivingTuesday online donation form at http://bit.ly/GiveTuesTSA19.

You may also drop off cash/check to Toledo School for the Arts with #GivingTuesday in the memo line. (333 14th St. Toledo, OH 43604)
